alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 29 at 5:26PM HST until April 29 at 7:15PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... At 526 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain continues over portions of the North Kona District. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. The most persistent heavy rain was falling around Keahole Point and Kailua-Kona. The Waiaha stream gauge showed water levels had peaked and begun to slowly recede. However heavy rainfall continues in the area and flash flooding impacts are expected to continue. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kailua-Kona, Captain Cook, Holualoa, Honalo, Kahaluu-Keauhou, Kainaliu, Kealakekua, Kalaoa, Puuanahulu, Honaunau and Kona International Airport. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
